metadata.title: CVE-2018-12384 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
When handling a SSLv2-compatible ClientHello request, the server doesn'tgenerate a new random value but sends an all-zero value instead. Thisresults in full malleability of the ClientHello for SSLv2 used for TLS 1.2in all versions prior to NSS 3.39. This does not impact TLS 1.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12384` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
